00043 #include <linux/sched.h>
00044 #include <linux/fs_struct.h>
00045 
00046 #include <linux/compat.h>
00047 #include <linux/thread_info.h>
00048 
00049 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00050 
00051 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * Implementation of cfs_curproc API (see portals/include/libcfs/curproc.h)
00055  * for Linux kernel.
00056  */
00057 
00058 /* Currently all the CFS_CAP_* defines match CAP_* ones. */
00059 #define cfs_cap_pack(cap) (cap)
00060 #define cfs_cap_unpack(cap) (cap)
00061 
00062 void cfs_cap_raise(cfs_cap_t cap)
00063 {
00064         struct cred *cred;
00065         if ((cred = prepare_creds())) {
00066                 cap_raise(cred->cap_effective, cfs_cap_unpack(cap));
00067                 commit_creds(cred);
00068         }
00069 }
00070 
00071 void cfs_cap_lower(cfs_cap_t cap)
00072 {
00073         struct cred *cred;
00074         if ((cred = prepare_creds())) {
00075                 cap_lower(cred->cap_effective, cfs_cap_unpack(cap));
00076                 commit_creds(cred);
00077         }
00078 }
00079 
00080 int cfs_cap_raised(cfs_cap_t cap)
00081 {
00082         return cap_raised(current_cap(), cfs_cap_unpack(cap));
00083 }
00084 
00085 static void cfs_kernel_cap_pack(kernel_cap_t kcap, cfs_cap_t *cap)
00086 {
00087 #if defined (_LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x19980330
00088         *cap = cfs_cap_pack(kcap);
00089 #elif defined (_LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x20071026
00090         *cap = cfs_cap_pack(kcap[0]);
00091 #elif defined(_KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x20080522
00092         /* XXX lost high byte */
00093         *cap = cfs_cap_pack(kcap.cap[0]);
00094 #else
00095         #error "need correct _KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION "
00096 #endif
00097 }
00098 
00099 static void cfs_kernel_cap_unpack(kernel_cap_t *kcap, cfs_cap_t cap)
00100 {
00101 #if defined (_LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x19980330
00102         *kcap = cfs_cap_unpack(cap);
00103 #elif defined (_LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _LINUX_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x20071026
00104         (*kcap)[0] = cfs_cap_unpack(cap);
00105 #elif defined(_KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION) && _KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION == 0x20080522
00106         kcap->cap[0] = cfs_cap_unpack(cap);
00107 #else
00108         #error "need correct _KERNEL_CAPABILITY_VERSION "
00109 #endif
00110 }
00111 
00112 cfs_cap_t cfs_curproc_cap_pack(void)
00113 {
00114         cfs_cap_t cap;
00115         cfs_kernel_cap_pack(current_cap(), &cap);
00116         return cap;
00117 }
00118 
00119 void cfs_curproc_cap_unpack(cfs_cap_t cap)
00120 {
00121         struct cred *cred;
00122         if ((cred = prepare_creds())) {
00123                 cfs_kernel_cap_unpack(&cred->cap_effective, cap);
00124                 commit_creds(cred);
00125         }
00126 }
00127 
00128 int cfs_capable(cfs_cap_t cap)
00129 {
00130         return capable(cfs_cap_unpack(cap));
00131 }
00132 
00133 static int cfs_access_process_vm(struct task_struct *tsk,
00134                                  struct mm_struct *mm,
00135                                  unsigned long addr,
00136                                  void *buf, int len, int write)
00137 {
00138         /* Just copied from kernel for the kernels which doesn't
00139          * have access_process_vm() exported */
00140         struct vm_area_struct *vma;
00141         struct page *page;
00142         void *old_buf = buf;
00143 
00144         /* Avoid deadlocks on mmap_sem if called from sys_mmap_pgoff(),
00145          * which is already holding mmap_sem for writes.  If some other
00146          * thread gets the write lock in the meantime, this thread will
00147          * block, but at least it won't deadlock on itself.  LU-1735 */
00148         if (down_read_trylock(&mm->mmap_sem) == 0)
00149                 return -EDEADLK;
00150 
00151         /* ignore errors, just check how much was successfully transferred */
00152         while (len) {
00153                 int bytes, rc, offset;
00154                 void *maddr;
00155 
00156                 rc = get_user_pages(tsk, mm, addr, 1,
00157                                      write, 1, &page, &vma);
00158                 if (rc <= 0)
00159                         break;
00160 
00161                 bytes = len;
00162                 offset = addr & (PAGE_SIZE-1);
00163                 if (bytes > PAGE_SIZE-offset)
00164                         bytes = PAGE_SIZE-offset;
00165 
00166                 maddr = kmap(page);
00167                 if (write) {
00168                         copy_to_user_page(vma, page, addr,
00169                                           maddr + offset, buf, bytes);
00170                         set_page_dirty_lock(page);
00171                 } else {
00172                         copy_from_user_page(vma, page, addr,
00173                                             buf, maddr + offset, bytes);
00174                 }
00175                 kunmap(page);
00176                 page_cache_release(page);
00177                 len -= bytes;
00178                 buf += bytes;
00179                 addr += bytes;
00180         }
00181         up_read(&mm->mmap_sem);
00182 
00183         return buf - old_buf;
00184 }
00185 
00186 /* Read the environment variable of current process specified by @key. */
00187 int cfs_get_environ(const char *key, char *value, int *val_len)
00188 {
00189         struct mm_struct *mm;
00190         char *buffer;
00191         int buf_len = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
00192         int key_len = strlen(key);
00193         unsigned long addr;
00194         int rc;
00195         bool skip = false;
00196         ENTRY;
00197 
00198         buffer = kmalloc(buf_len, GFP_USER);
00199         if (!buffer)
00200                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00201 
00202         mm = get_task_mm(current);
00203         if (!mm) {
00204                 kfree(buffer);
00205                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00206         }
00207 
00208         addr = mm->env_start;
00209         while (addr < mm->env_end) {
00210                 int this_len, retval, scan_len;
00211                 char *env_start, *env_end;
00212 
00213                 memset(buffer, 0, buf_len);
00214 
00215                 this_len = min_t(int, mm->env_end - addr, buf_len);
00216                 retval = cfs_access_process_vm(current, mm, addr, buffer,
00217                                                this_len, 0);
00218                 if (retval < 0)
00219                         GOTO(out, rc = retval);
00220                 else if (retval != this_len)
00221                         break;
00222 
00223                 addr += retval;
00224 
00225                 /* Parse the buffer to find out the specified key/value pair.
00226                  * The "key=value" entries are separated by '\0'. */
00227                 env_start = buffer;
00228                 scan_len = this_len;
00229                 while (scan_len) {
00230                         char *entry;
00231                         int entry_len;
00232 
00233                         env_end = memscan(env_start, '\0', scan_len);
00234                         LASSERT(env_end >= env_start &&
00235                                 env_end <= env_start + scan_len);
00236 
00237                         /* The last entry of this buffer cross the buffer
00238                          * boundary, reread it in next cycle. */
00239                         if (unlikely(env_end - env_start == scan_len)) {
00240                                 /* Just skip the entry larger than page size,
00241                                  * it can't be jobID env variable. */
00242                                 if (unlikely(scan_len == this_len))
00243                                         skip = true;
00244                                 else
00245                                         addr -= scan_len;
00246                                 break;
00247                         } else if (unlikely(skip)) {
00248                                 skip = false;
00249                                 goto skip;
00250                         }
00251 
00252                         entry = env_start;
00253                         entry_len = env_end - env_start;
00254 
00255                         /* Key length + length of '=' */
00256                         if (entry_len > key_len + 1 &&
00257                             !memcmp(entry, key, key_len)) {
00258                                 entry += key_len + 1;
00259                                 entry_len -= key_len + 1;
00260                                 /* The 'value' buffer passed in is too small.*/
00261                                 if (entry_len >= *val_len)
00262                                         GOTO(out, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
00263 
00264                                 memcpy(value, entry, entry_len);
00265                                 *val_len = entry_len;
00266                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00267                         }
00268 skip:
00269                         scan_len -= (env_end - env_start + 1);
00270                         env_start = env_end + 1;
00271                 }
00272         }
00273         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00274 
00275 out:
00276         mmput(mm);
00277         kfree((void *)buffer);
00278         return rc;
00279 }
00280 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_get_environ);
00281 
00282 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_cap_raise);
00283 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_cap_lower);
00284 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_cap_raised);
00285 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_curproc_cap_pack);
00286 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_capable);
